str2: According to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as. From kata and hos; just as, that.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To put to death, subdue; pass: To be in danger of death, be dead to, be rid of, be parted from. From thanatos to kill.
All, the whole, entire, complete. A primary word; 'whole' or 'all', i.e. Complete, especially as noun or adverb.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 1st Person Plural
str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
Slaughter, sacrifice. From sphazo; butchery (figuratively) of men (destruction).
